captions.text: One of my friends is like, "aw, you don't know what it is?"
And I was like, "Oh!" But I still didn't really know what it was.
*Music*
Everytime I though of a vagina, I was convinced that it was just one hole.
I remember definitely thinking that the vagina was like, flat.
In front, like it was just below the belly button.
I assumed that women had the same genitals that I did.
And then it was like separated into three separate tunnels.
for the poop, the pee and the baby.
I remember very specifically seeing a picture of a naked women and saying, "she doesn't have anything down there"
"What? What's going on?"
I wasn't sure like what was supposed- I knew it was supposed to go in a hole.
The male took his penis and rubbed it on top of the vagina. Not inside the vagina.
A man lied this way and a woman lied this way.
I wasn't sure like how, where?
I always though missionary was just the way you had sex to make a baby. And when you were a heathen, you would do it doggy-style.
Because that would get it into Willy Wonka's chocolate factory.
I was looking for a blank VHS tape so I could record an episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000.
I put it in and it was very close up of a woman's vagina.
And the woman's face comes into the frame and I'm like, "What is going on!"
Suddenly you would hear people going down the stairs and you'd be like, "Oh, My GOD!"
I remember one time I got here, that was fine and
I close the tabs and I close them but there was pop-ups and my mom came around.
And then she clicked on it and it was this pop-up and it was like way dirtier than the stuff I was watching.
But you're not going to be like, "No I wasn't watching that porn! I was watching other porn!"
I just wanted to watch a couple robots and a man make fun of a B-movie. I got so much more.
My parent were just like, "I'm never going to talk about sex to Keith and he'll never have sex"
Every time I tried to have a sex talk with my mom, her like instinctive response is, "don't do it, you're dick will get cancer."
And I was like, "F&%#... I will never stick my penis in another person."
I can't remember how he said it but he basically wanted to start a conversation.
about sex and then he was like, "Don't worry..."
"I lost my virginity when I was 15, and it was with an older girl"
and I was like, "Well, I'm 16 and I still have't lost my virginity.."
"and this is the worst, most embarrassing conversation we can possibly have right now!"
"Shut up, how do I stop this conversation?!"

title: Guys' Misconceptions about Sex (When They Were Younger)

comments.text:
I never really had "the talk" with my parents. The most we ever talked 
about it was when I was like 10, I had watched channel 69 at a hotel, and 
when we got home I asked my mom what sex was. She just said "a man puts his 
weewee into a woman's butt (this is a literal translation) and he moves it 
back and forth for some time." I was so confused. Later, when I was like 
14, I had done my research and knew mostly everything I needed to know, and 
every time after that when my mom would bring the topic up, I'd just tell 
her I know already and she doesn't have to bother explaining anything to 
me. These days I'd say I know more about sex than she does, judging from 
the fact that she has no idea how gay/lesbian sex works.﻿

comments.author: McScizz

comments.text:
I was a rather innocent child. I'm pretty darn gay (mostly) and so I never 
really thought about girl parts very much. I remember thinking that they 
had one hole in which the penis would go in. I also thought that women 
urinated out of that same hole. This isn't so much about sex, but I thought 
that women didn't have nipples. I thought that was a guy thing, and when I 
envisioned a girl's chest, I saw breasts with no nipples.

I also had no idea what masturbation was, despite my friends knowing and 
talking about it. I played along, but secretly, I was like "What the hell 
is that?"

My misconceptions were corrected when I found a certain file on my 
computer. The computer was passed down to me from one of my brothers I 
think, and well... That file was all I needed to understand most of how sex 
works.

I wasn't really given the sex talk unless health class counts. I knew about 
sexual intercourse and its affiliations long before that health class, 
though. In this day and age, really young kids know what sex is. I'm not 
saying that's a good thing - it's not, it's kind of like a deprivation of 
innocence. I think that having the sex talk with kids - even if they 
already know what it pertains to - is important because today's kids know 
what it is, but they don't know the sacredness of it, and they don't 
necessarily know what precautions to take when attempting it.

I had to discover gay sex all on my own, in my teenage years. *coughs* *gay 
porn*

I really wish students were educated on gay sex in health class. I wish I 
had been.﻿

comments.author: TheFubbick

comments.text:
My version of "The Talk" was my mother walking in on me reading The Count 
of Monte Cristo and asking if I wanted a forty-year-old book about the 
female body. I was sixteen at the time. I had a solid grasp on the concept 
of my gender for four years.

I assume there might have been things related to sex in it but the internet 
was in full swing and I never left the computer for most of my adolescence. 
I recall having my first unsolicited genital picture at fourteen.﻿
comments.author: Synalla

comments.text: Don't do it your dick will get cancer﻿
comments.author: THE BROKEN FORGOTTEN AND LOST

comments.text:
My mom just explained to me what sex was when I was 5 or something and I 
asked her. She told me where babies came from, the differences between a 
man and a woman and etc. And I of course told any other 5 year old I talked 
to ending the sentence with: "why do you think your parents sleep 
together?" xD﻿
